field.label: Products per page
field.comment: Limits the amount of product Channable will import per run. This setting will not limit the total products sent to Channable but will lower the load.

group.label: Product Data
group.comment: Connect the right attributes for the basic product values to the Channable feed.

field.label: Name
field.comment: Select the attribute associate with the product name. Suggested field: Product Name

field.label: Description
field.comment: Select the attribute associated with the product description. Suggested field: Description

field.label: Brand
field.comment: Select the attribute associated with the brand or manufacturer. Suggested field: Brand or manufacturer

field.label: EAN / GTIN
field.comment: Select the attribute associated with the product EAN / GTIN. Suggested field: EAN

field.label: Image Source
field.comment: It is recommended that you select all images if they are available, so that any additional images are also exported.

field.label: Main Image
field.comment: Select the source for the main image, other images will be exported as additional image(s).

field.label: Miscellaneous fields
field.comment: It is recommended to provide the following product information for each unique item you submit if it exists.

group.label: Product Types
group.comment: Configure the three different product types to make sure that you are using the right attribute values for the different product types.

field.label: Configurable Products
field.comment: For configurable products, we recommend to only add the simple products to the configuration as a ‘configurable product’ by itself cannot be purchased. Choose the attribute(s) that you want to use from the parent relation configurable product.

field.label: Use Configurable/Simple Products
field.comment: Recommended: Only Linked Simple Products. Selecting this option will export linked simple products that are part of a configurable product. This option is recommended so that the unique product variants are exported to Channable.

field.label: Use Parent URL for Simples
field.comment: Recommended: Yes, with Auto-Link. In this way the URL will be automatically link to the correct simple product on the configurable product landing page.

field.label: Use Parent Image for Simples
field.comment: Recommended: Only if Empty. In this way the parent image will only be used when there isn't a image available on the simple product.

field.label: Use Parent Data for Simples
field.comment: Select the attributes that you want to use from the parent configurable product. It is not recommended to select the attributes that need to be unique for the simples, such as GTIN and Color.

field.label: Use Fallback only on Non Visible Simples
field.comment: Recommended: Yes. This selecting will use the logic for the attribute fallback and relations on simples with the visibility "Not Visible Individually". Simples that are visible in the catalog are treated as "normal" simple products without relations.

field.label: Bundle Products
field.comment: For Bundle Products, we recommend to only add the Bundle product by itself as this is the item that can be purchased.

field.label: Use Bundle Products
field.comment: Recommended: Only Bundle Product. Selecting this option will export the bundle product by itself to Channable.

field.label: Use Parent URL for Simples
field.comment: Recommended: Yes. Selecting this option will export the URL that links directly to the Bundle Product.

field.label: Use Parent Image for Simples
field.comment: Recommended: Only if empty. Selecting this option will export the parent image which will be used if there is no image available for a simple product

field.label: Use Parent Data for Simples
field.comment: Select the attributes that you want to use from the parent bundle product. It is not recommended to select the attributes that need to be unique for the simples, such as GTIN and Color.

field.label: Use Fallback only on Non Visible Simples
field.comment: Recommended: Yes. This selecting will use the logic for the attribute fallback and relations on simples with the visibility "Not Visible Individually". Simples that are visible in the catalog are treated as "normal" simple products without relations.

field.label: Grouped Products
field.comment: For Group Products, we recommend to only add the Grouped Product by itself as that is the product that can be purchased.

field.label: Use Grouped Products
field.comment: Recommended: Only Grouped Product. Selecting this option will export the bundle product by itself to Channable.

field.label: Use Parent URL for Simples
field.comment: Recommended: Yes. Selecting this option will export the URL that links directly to the Grouped Product.

field.label: Use Parent Image for Simples
field.comment: Recommended: Only if Empty. Selecting this option will export the parent image which will be used if there is no image available for a simple product.

field.label: Use Parent Data for Simples
field.comment: Select the attributes that you want to use from the parent grouped product. It is not recommended to select the attributes that need to be unique for the simples, such as GTIN and Color.

field.label: Use Fallback only on Non Visible Simples
field.comment: Recommended: Yes. This selecting will use the logic for the attribute fallback and relations on simples with the visibility "Not Visible Individually". Simples that are visible in the catalog are treated as "normal" simple products without relations.

group.label: Filter Options
group.comment: This option allows you to include/exclude products from the Channable feed based on the product visibility or stock information.

field.label: Filter on Status
field.comment: By default only enabled products are added.

field.label: Filter on Visibility
field.comment: Include or exclude products based on the visibility.

field.label: Only add products with the following Visibility
field.comment: Add products with the selected visibility.

field.label: Filter by Category
field.comment: Include or Exclude products based on the category.

field.label: Category
field.comment:
Include or Exclude products based on the category.

Note for Include:
Simple products within a bundled, configurable or grouped product are treated as own entities, so these should also be present in the included categories. Check the "Products in category" tab in the category manager to make sure the category contains the products which you want to be included.

Note for Exclude:
Exclude the products from these categories. Products that are available within different categories need to be excluded from all of the categories they are assigned to. Check the "Products in category" tab in the category manager to make sure the category contains the products which you want to be excluded.

field.label: Exclude Out of Stock
field.comment: Exclude products that are out of stock in your store.

group.label: Advanced Options
group.comment: We recommend adding as many attributes as possible to Channable as this will improve the quality of your data. In this section you can add extra fields, set the right inventory data and configure the fallback on your configurable & grouped and bundled products.

field.label: Extra Fields
field.comment: You can add custom fields with your attributes to enrich your data in Channable. Click the Add button to add an attribute with a custom fieldname as reference.

field.label: Inventory Data
field.comment: Select the inventory data that you want to export to Channable using the multi-select below.

field.label: Force NON-MSI
field.comment: Force the use of legacy stock QTY ignoring the Reservation and Salable QTY table. Only use this function in case you are not using MSI and the QTY in the feed is not correct. Recommended option: No

field.label: Delivery Time
field.comment: Set the delivery time for your products using the table below or use your own attribute in the extra field table.

field.label: Content Staging
field.comment: Content Staging gives the ability to easily create, preview, and schedule a wide range of content updates. This is available in Magento Commerce only.

field.label: Use Row ID for Simple/Parent relations
field.comment: Experimental option; only enable this if the simple/parent relations are out of sync.

group.label: General
group.comment: Connect your store with Channable Marketplaces using the Channable Marketplace API, you can configure the Order Import settings and the Item Update settings per Store View.

group.label: Item Update
group.comment: In order to use the Channable Item API, you have to set the API settings on the store level where you want to import the orders from Channable. The settings are only visible when you have the right store-view selected through the store switcher on the top left.

field.label: Modus
field.comment: Log Product movements using Observer or Cron.

field.label: Cron
field.comment: Configure the Item update with the values below, we highly recommend to check your Magento cron job functionality to make sure all your items are updated frequently.

field.label: Products per run
field.comment: Set a limit on the number of products for each update with a maximum value of <strong>50</strong.>

field.label: Log Calls
field.comment: Write all the calls and updates to the Channable log file located in /var/log/channable.log.

field.label: Enabled Stores
field.comment: You can only activate and or set the Webhook per specific Store View. You can select the Store Views using the dropdown on the top of the left.

group.label: Returns
group.comment: In order to use the Channable Item API, you have to set the API settings on the store level where you want to import the orders from Channable. The settings are only visible when you have the right store-view selected through the store switcher on the top left.

field.label: Webhooks
field.comment: Copy and paste the Webhook URL to configure your Magento Store in your Channable Marketplace account. Make sure that you copy the complete URL as the URL is partly hidden because of the length.

field.label: Replace by Channel Name
field.comment: If enabled; channel name will be used as carrier title, eg. Amazon

field.label: Replace by Selected Shipping Method
field.comment: If enabled; selected shipping method from platform will be used for name, eg. Prime
